Standard ML of New Jersey
Version 110.63.1 NEWS
May 3, 2007

WARNING
This working version is believed to be stable, and has passed the regression test suite. However, there is quite a bit of new code in the FLINT middle end and at the interface between the Front End and FLINT, so this is not considered a mature working release.
SML/NJ HOME:
http://www.smlnj.org/index.html
FILES:
http://smlnj.cs.uchicago.edu/dist/working/110.63.1/

Summary:

This release includes new code merged from the primop-branch-3 development branch. Many of the changes affect FLINT and its interaction with the front end, and particularly the system for supporting primops (primitive operations).

Details:

Front End and FLINT:
  • Implemented a new scheme for defining primops and tracking and analyzing their types in the type checker and in FLINT.
  • Improved signature printing by making it faithfully reflect the original order of specification or definition.
  • Began to streamline the type system of the plambda and flint intermediate languages.
  • Fixed some minor bugs in the type checker and module system.
SML Basis library:
  • Fixed a bug in the implementation of order operations and min and max for Int32. Fixed a few other bugs in the Basis that were revealed by running the regression tests.
Regression Tests:
  • Revised the regression test suite and brought the tests and reference outputs up to date. Cleaned up test scripts.
ml-lpt:
    Major revisions, including addition of a table-based mode for lexical analyzers with large numbers of states.
runtime:
